edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib
Class Packet

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.Packet

public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object

   
 Packet defines the MessageLayer packet headers and some constants.

dest - The destination address.
src - The source address.
protocol - What type of packet this is.
payload - The payload of the packet.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given arguments are invalid

Packet

private Packet(int dest,
               int src,
               int protocol,
               int flags,
               byte[] payload)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a new Packet and allows setting of the flags. This should only be used to unpack arbitrary packets while reading a byte stream

Parameters:
dest - The destination address.
src - The source address.
protocol - What type of packet this is.
flags - The flags byte of the packet
payload - The payload of the packet.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Method Detail

getFinPacket

protected static Packet getFinPacket(int node)
Constructs a new FIN packet that is meant to signal a node quit in Emulator mode and facilitate connection closing

Parameters:
node - The address of the node that is leaving the network
Returns:
The FIN packet

getReplayPacket

protected static Packet getReplayPacket(int addr,
                                        int protocol,
                                        byte[] payload)
Constructs a new replay packet that is meant to represent non packet external input for replays

Parameters:
addr - The address value
protocol - The replay protocol (see Replay class)
payload - The payload of the packet
Returns:
The REPLAY packet

pack

protected byte[] pack()
Convert the Packet object into a byte array for sending over the wire. Format: destination address: 1 byte source address: 1 byte protocol: 1 byte flags: 1 byte payload length: 4 byte payload: <= MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE bytes

Returns:
A byte[] for transporting over the wire. Null if failed to pack for some reason

unpack

protected static Packet unpack(byte[] packedPacket)
                        throws Packet.CorruptPacketException
Unpacks a byte array to create a Packet object. Assumes the array has been formatted using pack method in Packet

Parameters:
packedPacket - String representation of the packet
Returns:
Packet Object created or null if the byte[] is empty
Throws:
Packet.CorruptPacketException - If the byte[] representation was corrupted

unpack

protected static Packet unpack(java.io.InputStream stream)
                        throws Packet.CorruptPacketException
Reads an input stream to create a Packet object. Assumes the array has been formatted using pack method in Packet

Parameters:
stream - Input stream (probably from a socket)
Returns:
Packet object created or null if the stream is at EOF
Throws:
Packet.CorruptPacketException - If the stream contains a corrupted packet

unpack

private static Packet unpack(java.io.DataInputStream in)
                      throws Packet.CorruptPacketException
General method to read a data stream to create a Packet object. Assumes the array has been formatted using pack method in Packet. Called by the other unpack methods.

Parameters:
in - The data stream
Returns:
Packet object created or null if the input stream is at EOF
Throws:
Packet.CorruptPacketException - If the stream contains a corrupted packet

Parameters:

Returns:
True is address is valid, else false
